quote: Happiness does not depend on what you have or who you are. It solely relies on what you think.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The root of suffering is attachment.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Happiness is not having a lot. Happiness is giving a lot.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Happiness will never come to those who fail to appreciate what they already have.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Health is the greatest gift, contentment is the greatest wealth, faithfulness is the best relationship.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn’t learn a lot today, at least we learned a little, and if we didn’t learn a little, at least we didn’t get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn’t die; so, let us all be thankful.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Happiness does not depend on external circumstances; it is governed by our mental attitude.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: True Love is born from understanding.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The trouble is, you think you have time.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: To keep the body in good health is a duty… otherwise, we shall not be able to keep our minds strong and clear.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Your work is to discover your world and then with all your heart give yourself to it.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: You can search throughout the entire universe for someone who is more deserving of your love and affection than you are yourself, and that person is not to be found anywhere. You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: With our thoughts, we make the world.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: In the end, these things matter most: How well did you love? How fully did you live? How deeply did you let go?
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: You cannot travel the path until you have become the path itself.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: No one saves us but ourselves.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: It is a man's own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: It is better to travel well than to arrive.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Whatever words we utter should be chosen with care for people will hear them and be influenced by them for good or ill.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: What we think, we become.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: We are what we think. All that we are arises with our thoughts. With our thoughts, we make the world.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: A jug fills drop by drop.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: He who walks in the eightfold noble path with unswerving determination is sure to reach Nirvana.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: A woman of the world is anxious to exhibit her form and shape, whether walking, standing, sitting, or sleeping. Even when represented as a picture, she desires to captivate with the charms of her beauty and, thus, to rob men of their steadfast heart.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: In a controversy the instant we feel anger we have already ceased striving for the truth, and have begun striving for ourselves.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Let my skin and sinews and bones dry up, together with all the flesh and blood of my body! I welcome it! But I will not move from this spot until I have attained the supreme and final wisdom.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: He who loves 50 people has 50 woes; he who loves no one has no woes.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: I am not the first Buddha who came upon Earth, nor shall I be the last. In due time, another Buddha will arise in the world - a Holy One, a supremely enlightened One, endowed with wisdom in conduct, auspicious, knowing the universe, an incomparable leader of men, a master of angels and mortals.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Of those beings who live in ignorance, shut up and confined, as it were, in an egg, I have first broken the eggshell of ignorance and alone in the universe obtained the most exalted, universal Buddhahood.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: All wrong-doing arises because of mind. If mind is transformed can wrong-doing remain?
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: When one has the feeling of dislike for evil, when one feels tranquil, one finds pleasure in listening to good teachings; when one has these feelings and appreciates them, one is free of fear.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Charity bestowed upon those who are worthy of it is like good seed sown on a good soil that yields an abundance of fruits. But alms given to those who are yet under the tyrannical yoke of the passions are like seed deposited in a bad soil. The passions of the receiver of the alms choke, as it were, the growth of merits.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: You can search throughout the entire universe for someone who is more deserving of your love and affection than you are yourself, and that person is not to be found anywhere. You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe deserve your love and affection.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Do not overrate what you have received, nor envy others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Unity can only be manifested by the Binary. Unity itself and the idea of Unity are already two.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Chaos is inherent in all compounded things. Strive on with diligence.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: He who gives away shall have real gain. He who subdues himself shall be free; he shall cease to be a slave of passions. The righteous man casts off evil, and by rooting out lust, bitterness, and illusion do we reach Nirvana.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Better than worshiping gods is obedience to the laws of righteousness.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: I was born into the world as the king of truth for the salvation of the world.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The foot feels the foot when it feels the ground.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: To be idle is a short road to death and to be diligent is a way of life; foolish people are idle, wise people are diligent.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Without health life is not life; it is only a state of langour and suffering - an image of death.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: With fools, there is no companionship. Rather than to live with men who are selfish, vain, quarrelsome, and obstinate, let a man walk alone.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: What is the appropriate behavior for a man or a woman in the midst of this world, where each person is clinging to his piece of debris? What's the proper salutation between people as they pass each other in this flood?
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: Virtue is persecuted more by the wicked than it is loved by the good.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The wise ones fashioned speech with their thought, sifting it as grain is sifted through a sieve.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The virtues, like the Muses, are always seen in groups. A good principle was never found solitary in any breast.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)

quote: The foolish man conceives the idea of 'self.' The wise man sees there is no ground on which to build the idea of 'self;' thus, he has a right conception of the world and well concludes that all compounds amassed by sorrow will be dissolved again, but the truth will remain.
author: Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha)
